docfields.name: todo
docfields.text: Todo List Member KNotification CloseWhenWidgetActivated make it work with tabulated widget Member KNotification RaiseWidgetOnActivation doesn t work yet

docfields.name: KNotification
docfields.text: There are two main kinds of notifications Feedback events For notifying the user that he/she just performed an operation like maximizing a window This allows us to play sounds when a dialog appears This is an instant notification It ends automatically after a small timeout persistant notifications Notify when the user received a new message or when something else important happened the user has to know about This notification has a start and a end It begins when the event actually occurs and finishes when the message is acknowledged or read Example of a persistent notification in an instant messaging application The application emits the notification when the message is actually received and closes it only when the user has read the message when the message window has received the focus using the close() slot Persistent notifications must have the Persistent flag By default a notification will use the application name as title but you can also provide a brief text in the title and a more precise description in the body text This is especially useful for notifications coming from applications which should be considered like a battery monitor or a network connection manager For example a battery indicator could use as a title and as a body text In order to perform a notification you need to create a description file which contains default parameters of the notification and use KNotification::event at the place in the application code where the notification occurs The returned KNotification pointer may be used to connect signals or slots Your application should install a file called knotifications5/appname.notifyrc in a QStandardPaths::GenericDataLocation directory The filename should either match QCoreApplication::applicationName or be specified as the component name to the KNotification object You can do this with the following CMake command install FILES appname.notifyrc DESTINATION KNOTIFYRC_INSTALL_DIR This file contains mainly 3 parts Global information Context information Definition of individual events The global part looks like that Global IconName Filename Comment Friendly Name of app Name Name of app The icon filename is just the name without extension it s found with the KIconLoader The Comment field will be used in KControl to describe the application The Name field is optional and may be used as the application name for popup if Name is not present Comment is used instead This part consists of hints for the configuration widget Context/group Name Group name Comment The name of the group for contacts Context/folder Name Group name The second part of the groupname is the context identifier It should not contain special characters The Name field is the one the user will see and which is translated The definition of the events forms the most important part of the config file Event/newmail Name New email Comment You have got a new email Contexts folder group Action Sound|Popup Event/contactOnline Name Contact goes online Comment One of your contact has been connected Contexts group Sound filetoplay.ogg Action None These are the default settings for each notifiable event Action is the string representing the action Actions can be added to KNotification as plugins by deriving from KNotificationPlugin At the time of writing the following actions are available Taskbar Sound Popup Logfile TTS Execute Actions can be combined by seperating them with Contexts is a comma separated list of possible context for this event This is an implementation detail and is described here for your information In the config file there are two parts the event configuration and the context information These are hints for the configuration dialog They contain both the internal id of the context and the user visible string Context/group Values 1 Friends 2 Work 3 Family This contains the configuration of events for the user It contains the same fields as the description file The key of groups is in the form Event/ EventName ContextName ContextValue Event/contactOnline Action Sound Sound ogg Event/contactOnline/group/1 Action Popup|Sound This portion of code will fire the event for the event Olivier Goffart ogoffart at kde.org

docfields.name: KNotification::Context
docfields.text: Example you want to be notified for mails that arrive in your folder but not for those in folder A notification context is a pair of two strings The first string is a key from what the context is example or not translated The second is the id of the context In our example the group id or the filter id in the applications These strings are the ones present in the config file and are in theory not shown in the user interface The order of contexts in the list is is important the most important context should be placed first They are processed in that order when the notification occurs event

docfields.name: KNotification::RaiseWidgetOnActivation
docfields.text: When the notification is activated raise the notification s widget This will change the desktop raise the window and switch to the tab doesn t work yet

docfields.name: KNotification::CloseOnTimeout
docfields.text: The notification will be automatically closed after a timeout this is the default

docfields.name: KNotification::Persistent
docfields.text: The notification will NOT be automatically closed after a timeout You will have to track the notification and close it with the close function manually when the event is done otherwise there will be a memory leak

docfields.name: KNotification::CloseWhenWidgetActivated
docfields.text: The notification will be automatically closed if the widget() becomes activated If the widget is already activated when the notification occurs the notification will be closed after a small timeout This only works if the widget is the toplevel widget make it work with tabulated widget

docfields.name: KNotification::LoopSound
docfields.text: The audio plugin will loop the sound until the notification is closed

docfields.name: KNotification::SkipGrouping
docfields.text: Sends a hint to Plasma to skip grouping for this notification 5.18

docfields.name: KNotification::DefaultEvent
docfields.text: The event is a standard kde event and not an event of the application

docfields.name: KNotification::activated
docfields.text: The parameter passed by the signal is the index of the action in the QStringList set by setActions() call action will be 0 is the default aciton was activated or the index of the action in the actions QStringList

docfields.name: KNotification::closed
docfields.text: Can be closed either by the user clicking the close button the timeout running out or when an action was triggered

docfields.name: KNotification::close
docfields.text: This will delete the notification

docfields.name: KNotification::deref
docfields.text: If the ref counter hits zero the notification will be closed and deleted ref

docfields.name: KNotification::raiseWidget
docfields.text: This will change the desktop activate the window and the tab if needed

docfields.name: KNotification::ref
docfields.text: if you want to show your own presentation in your application you should use this function so it will not be automatically closed when there is nothing to show Don t forgot to deref or the notification may be never closed if there is no timeout deref

docfields.name: KNotification::sendEvent
docfields.text: This will cause all the configured plugins to execute their actions on this notification eg a sound will play a popup will show a command will be executed etc

docfields.name: KNotification::update
docfields.text: update the texts the icon and the actions of one existing notification

docfields.name: KNotification::KNotification
docfields.text: You have to use sendEvent to show the notification The pointer is automatically deleted when the event is closed Make sure you use one of the NotificationFlags CloseOnTimeOut or CloseWhenWidgetActivated if not you have to close the notification yourself eventId is the name of the event widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag

docfields.name: KNotification::KNotification
docfields.text: You have to use sendEvent to show the notification The pointer is automatically deleted when the event is closed Make sure you use one of the NotificationFlags CloseOnTimeOut or CloseWhenWidgetActivated if not you have to close the notification yourself 4.4 eventId is the name of the event flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag parent parent object

docfields.name: KNotification::actions
docfields.text: the list of actions

docfields.name: KNotification::addContext
docfields.text: context the context which is added

docfields.name: KNotification::addContext
docfields.text: context_key is the key of the context context_value is the value of the context

docfields.name: KNotification::appName
docfields.text: appname used for the dbus object

docfields.name: KNotification::contexts
docfields.text: the list of contexts see KNotification::Context

docfields.name: KNotification::eventId
docfields.text: the name of the event

docfields.name: KNotification::flags
docfields.text: the notification flags

docfields.name: KNotification::iconName
docfields.text: the icon shown in the popup setIconName 5.4

docfields.name: KNotification::id
docfields.text: the id given by the notification manager

docfields.name: KNotification::pixmap
docfields.text: the pixmap shown in the popup setPixmap

docfields.name: KNotification::setActions
docfields.text: The strings passed in that QStringList will be used as labels for those actions so ideally they should be wrapped in i18n() or tr() calls In Plasma workspace these will be shown as buttons inside the notification popup The visual representation of actions however depends on the notification server actions List of strings used as action labels

docfields.name: KNotification::setComponentName
docfields.text: If no componentName is set the app name is used by default componentName the new component name

docfields.name: KNotification::setContexts
docfields.text: The list of contexts must be set before calling sendEvent

docfields.name: KNotification::setFlags
docfields.text: These must be set before calling sendEvent()

docfields.name: KNotification::setIconName
docfields.text: icon the icon 5.4

docfields.name: KNotification::setPixmap
docfields.text: pix the pixmap

docfields.name: KNotification::setText
docfields.text: In Plasma workspace the text is shown in a QML label which uses Text.StyledText ie it supports a small subset of HTML entities mostly just formatting tags If the notifications server does not advertise capability all HTML tags are stripped before sending it to the server text The text to display in the notification popup

docfields.name: KNotification::setTitle
docfields.text: If no title is set the application name will be used title The title of the notification 4.3

docfields.name: KNotification::setWidget
docfields.text: The notification is reparented to the new widget widget() widget the new widget

docfields.name: KNotification::text
docfields.text: the notification text setText

docfields.name: KNotification::title
docfields.text: the notification title setTitle 4.3

docfields.name: KNotification::widget
docfields.text: If the widget is destroyed the notification will be automatically cancelled If the widget is activated the notification will be automatically closed if the NotificationFlags specify that When the notification is activated the widget might be raised Depending on the configuration the taskbar entry of the window containing the widget may blink

docfields.name: KNotification::beep
docfields.text: reason a short text explaining what has happened may be empty widget the widget the notification refers to

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This method creates the KNotification setting every parameter and fire the event You don t need to call sendEvent A popup may be displayed or a sound may be played depending the config a KNotification You may use that pointer to connect some signals or slot the pointer is automatically deleted when the event is closed Make sure you use one of the CloseOnTimeOut or CloseWhenWidgetActivated if not you have to close yourself the notification the text is shown in a QLabel you should escape HTML if needed eventId is the name of the event title is title of the notification to show in the popup text is the text of the notification to show in the popup pixmap is a picture which may be shown in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag componentName used to determine the location of the config file by default appname is used 4.4

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member function provided for convenience It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts This will emit a standard event eventId is the name of the event text is the text of the notification to show in the popup pixmap is a picture which may be shown in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag componentName used to determine the location of the config file by default plasma_workspace is used

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member function provided for convenience It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts This will emit a standard event eventId is the name of the event text is the text of the notification to show in the popup pixmap is a picture which may be shown in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member function provided for convenience It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts This will emit a standard event eventId is the name of the event title is title of the notification to show in the popup text is the text of the notification to show in the popup pixmap is a picture which may be shown in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag 4.4

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member function provided for convenience It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts This will emit a standard event eventId is the name of the event title is title of the notification to show in the popup text is the text of the notification to show in the popup iconName a Freedesktop compatible icon name to be shown in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag componentName used to determine the location of the config file by default plasma_workspace is used 5.4

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member function provided for convenience It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts This will emit a standard event with a custom icon eventId the type of the standard not app-defined event title is title of the notification to show in the popup text is the text of the notification to show in the popup iconName a Freedesktop compatible icon name to be shown in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag 5.9

docfields.name: KNotification::event
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member function provided for convenience It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts This will emit a standard event with its standard icon eventId the type of the standard not app-defined event title is title of the notification to show in the popup text is the text of the notification to show in the popup widget is a widget where the notification reports to flags is a bitmask of NotificationFlag 5.9

docfields.name: KNotificationPlugin
docfields.text: A KNotificationPlugin is responsible of notification presentation You can subclass it to have your own presentation of a notification You should reimplement the KNotificationPlugin::notify method to display the notification Olivier Goffart ogoffart at kde.org

docfields.name: KNotificationPlugin::actionInvoked
docfields.text: id is the id of the notification action is the action number zero for the default action

docfields.name: KNotificationPlugin::notify
docfields.text: or re-sent You should implement this function to display a notification for each call to this function even for re-notification you MUST call finish(KNotification*) notification is the KNotification object notifyConfig is the configuration of the notification

docfields.name: KNotificationPlugin::optionName
docfields.text: this is the name that should appear in the notifyrc file in the field Action if a notification is set to use this plugin

docfields.name: KNotificationPlugin::finish
docfields.text: call it when the presentation is finished because the user closed the popup or the sound is finished If your presentation is synchronous you can even call this function from the notify() call itself

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions
docfields.text: Using KNotificationRestrictions is quite straightforward create an instance of KNotificationRestrictions passing in the set of or d flags representing the services that should be prevented from interrupting the user When done for instance when the presentation is complete simply delete the KNotificationRestrictions object Example to ensure the screensaver does not turn on during a presentation

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions::NoServices
docfields.text: The baseline value

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions::ScreenSaver
docfields.text: Causes the screensaver to be prevented from automatically turning on

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions::MessagingPopups
docfields.text: Causes instant messaging and email notifications to not appear not implemented yet

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions::Notifications
docfields.text: Causes non-critical desktop messages to be suppressed not implemented yet

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions::CriticalNotifications
docfields.text: Causes all desktop notifications including critical ones such as as warnings to be suppressed not implemented yet

docfields.name: KNotificationRestrictions::KNotificationRestrictions
docfields.text: control the services to be restricted parent the parent of this object

docfields.name: KNotifyConfig
docfields.text: Olivier Goffart

docfields.name: KNotifyConfig::readEntry
docfields.text: entry from the knotifyrc file This will return the configuration from the user for the given key It first look into the user config file and then in the global config file return a null string if the entry doesn t exist

docfields.name: KNotifyConfig::reparseConfiguration
docfields.text: to be used when the config may have changed

docfields.name: KPassivePopup
docfields.text: The simplest uses of KPassivePopup are by using the various message() static methods The position the popup appears at depends on the type of the parent window Normal Windows The popup is placed adjacent to the icon of the window System Tray Windows The popup is placed adjacent to the system tray window itself Skip Taskbar Windows The popup is placed adjacent to the window itself if it is visible and at the edge of the desktop otherwise You also have the option of calling show with a QPoint as a parameter that removes the automatic placing of KPassivePopup and shows it in the point you want The most basic use of KPassivePopup displays a popup containing a piece of text We can create popups with titles and icons too as this example shows This screenshot shows a popup with both a caption and a main text which is being displayed next to the toolbar icon of the window that triggered it A passive popup For more control over the popup you can use the setView(QWidget *) method to create a custom popup Richard Moore Sascha Cunz

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::Boxed
docfields.text: Information will appear in a framed box default

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::Balloon
docfields.text: Information will appear in a comic-alike balloon

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::setPopupStyle
docfields.text: PopupStyle

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::setTimeout
docfields.text: Setting the delay to 0 disables the timeout if you re doing this you may want to connect the clicked() signal to the hide() slot Setting the delay to makes it use the default value timeout

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::setVisible
docfields.text: Reimplemented from superclass

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::autoDelete
docfields.text: setAutoDelete

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::setAnchor
docfields.text: The popup is placed near to the anchor

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::setAutoDelete
docfields.text: The default is false unless created by one of the static message() overloads

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::standardView
docfields.text: You can use the returned widget to customize the passivepopup while keeping the look similar to the passivepopups After customizing the widget pass it to setView( QWidget* ) caption The window caption title on the popup text The text for the popup icon The icon to use for the popup parent The parent widget used for the returned widget If left 0 then i.e the passive popup object will be used a QWidget containing the given arguments looking like the standard passivepopups The returned widget contains a QVBoxLayout which is accessible through layout() setView( QWidget * ) setView( const QString&, const QString& ) setView( const QString&, const QString&, const QPixmap& )

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::defaultLocation
docfields.text: The default implementation returns the top-left corner of the available work area of the desktop ie minus panels etc

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::hideEvent
docfields.text: Reimplemented from superclass

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::mouseReleaseEvent
docfields.text: Reimplemented from superclass

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::moveNear
docfields.text: The popup will be placed adjacent to but outside of target without going off the current desktop Reimplementations of positionSelf() can use this to actually position the popup

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::paintEvent
docfields.text: Reimplemented from superclass

docfields.name: KPassivePopup::positionSelf
docfields.text: The default implementation attempts to place it by the taskbar entry failing that it places it by the window of the associated widget failing that it places it at the location given by defaultLocation() moveNear()

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem
docfields.text: This class implements the Status notifier Item Dbus specification It provides an icon similar to the classical systemtray icons with some key differences the actual representation is done by the systemtray or the app behaving like it itself not by this app Since 4.5 this also includes the menu which means you cannot use embed widgets in the menu there is communication between the systemtray and the icon owner so the system tray can know if the application is in a normal or in a requesting attention state icons are divided in categories so the systemtray can represent in a different way the icons from normal applications and for instance the ones about hardware status Whenever possible you should prefer passing icon by name rather than by pixmap because it is much lighter on Dbus no need to pass all image pixels it makes it possible for the systemtray to load an icon of the appropriate size or to replace your icon with a systemtray specific icon which matches with the desktop theme some implementations of the system tray do not support passing icons by pixmap and will show a blank icon instead Marco Martin 4.4

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::ApplicationStatus
docfields.text: An icon for a normal application can be seen as its taskbar entry

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::Communications
docfields.text: This is a communication oriented application this icon will be used for things such as the notification of a new message

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::SystemServices
docfields.text: This is a system service it can show itself in the system tray if it requires interaction from the user or wants to inform him about something

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::Hardware
docfields.text: This application shows hardware status or a means to control it

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::Passive
docfields.text: Nothing is happening in the application so showing this icon is not required

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::Active
docfields.text: The application is doing something or it is important that the icon is always reachable from the user

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::NeedsAttention
docfields.text: The application requests the attention of the user for instance battery running out or a new IM message was received

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::activateRequested
docfields.text: active if it s true the application asked for the activatin of the main window if it s false it asked for hiding pos the position in the screen where the user clicked to trigger this signal QPoint() if it s not the consequence of a mouse click

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::scrollRequested
docfields.text: delta the amount of scrolling can be either positive or negative orientation direction of the scrolling can be either horizontal or vertical

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::secondaryActivateRequested
docfields.text: pos the position in the screen where the user clicked to trigger this signal QPoint() if it s not the consequence of a mouse click

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::activate
docfields.text: pos if it s a valid position it represents the mouse coordinates when the event was triggered

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::KStatusNotifierItem
docfields.text: parent the parent object for this object If the object passed in as a parent is also a QWidget it will be used as the main application window represented by this icon and will be shown/hidden when an activation is requested associatedWidget

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::KStatusNotifierItem
docfields.text: If your application has more than one status notifier item and the user should be able to manipulate them separately e.g mark them for hiding in a user interface the id can be used to differentiate between them The id should remain consistent even between application restarts Status notifier items without ids default to the application s name for the id This id may be used for instance by hosts displaying status notifier items to associate configuration information with this item in a way that can persist between sessions or application restarts id the unique id for this icon parent the parent object for this object If the object passed in as a parent is also a QWidget it will be used as the main application window represented by this icon and will be shown/hidden when an activation is requested associatedWidget

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::action
docfields.text: name the name of the action to retrieve 5.12

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::addAction
docfields.text: name the name of the action action the action we want to add

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::attentionIconName
docfields.text: the name of the icon to be displayed when the application is requesting the user s attention if attentionImage() is not empty this will always return an empty string

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::attentionIconPixmap
docfields.text: a pixmap of the requesting attention icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::attentionMovieName
docfields.text: the name of the movie to be displayed when the application is requesting the user attention

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::category
docfields.text: the application category

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::iconName
docfields.text: the name of the main icon to be displayed if image() is not empty this will always return an empty string

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::iconPixmap
docfields.text: a pixmap of the icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::id
docfields.text: The id which was specified in the constructor This should be guaranteed to be consistent between application starts and untranslated as host applications displaying items may use it for storing configuration related to this item

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::overlayIconName
docfields.text: the name of the icon to be used as overlay fr the main one

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::overlayIconPixmap
docfields.text: a pixmap of the icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::removeAction
docfields.text: name the name of the action

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setAssociatedWidget
docfields.text: If you pass contextMenu() as a parent then the menu will be displayed when the user activate the icon In this case the activate() method will not be called and the activateRequested() signal will not be emitted parent the new main widget must be a top level window if it s not parent- window() will be used instead

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setAttentionIconByName
docfields.text: name QIcon::fromTheme compatible name of icon to use

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setAttentionIconByPixmap
docfields.text: Use setAttentionIcon(const QString) instead when possible icon QIcon to use for requesting attention

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setAttentionMovieByName
docfields.text: This overrides anything set in setAttentionIcon()

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setCategory
docfields.text: category the new category for this icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setContextMenu
docfields.text: the menu will be shown with a contextMenu(int,int) call by the systemtray over dbus usually you don t need to call this unless you want to use a custom QMenu subclass as context menu The KStatusNotifierItem instance takes ownerhip of the menu and will delete it upon its destruction

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setIconByName
docfields.text: name it must be a QIcon::fromTheme compatible name this is the preferred way to set an icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setIconByPixmap
docfields.text: pixmap our icon use setIcon(const QString) when possible

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setOverlayIconByName
docfields.text: icon name if name is and empty QString() and overlayIconPixmap() is empty too the icon will be removed

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setOverlayIconByPixmap
docfields.text: pixmap our overlay icon use setOverlayIcon(const QString) when possible

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setToolTip
docfields.text: iconName a QIcon::fromTheme compatible name for the tootip icon title tootip title subTitle subtitle for the toolTip

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setToolTip
docfields.text: This is an overloaded member provided for convenience

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setToolTipIconByName
docfields.text: name the name for the icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::setToolTipIconByPixmap
docfields.text: Use setToolTipIconByName(QString) if possible pixmap representing the icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::showMessage
docfields.text: If possible use KNotify instead title message title message the actual text shown to the user icon icon to be shown to the user timeout how much time will elaps before hiding the message

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::standardActionsEnabled
docfields.text: if the standard items in the menu such as Quit

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::status
docfields.text: the current application status

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::title
docfields.text: the title of this icon

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::toolTipIconName
docfields.text: the name of the toolTip icon if toolTipImage() is not empty this will always return an empty string

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::toolTipIconPixmap
docfields.text: a serialization of the toolTip icon data

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::toolTipSubTitle
docfields.text: the subtitle of the main icon toolTip

docfields.name: KStatusNotifierItem::toolTipTitle
docfields.text: the title of the main icon toolTip

docfields.name: NotifyByPopupGrowl
docfields.text: Currently this class uses QSystemTrayIcon to actually display the notification Inside the Growl project a protocol is being developed to display notifications this protocol is currently only implemented partly in the Windows version of Growl Once it is finished it will be implemented in KNotify and used instead The normal Growl API is written in Objective C It s possible to use it but it s a lot harder than just waiting for GNTP to stabilize

docfields.name: NotifyByPopupGrowl::canPopup
docfields.text: Currently this checks only if Growl is installed not if it s running As soon as the Growl Notification Protocol is finished it will be implemented and used for this check

docfields.name: NotifyByPopupGrowl::popup

docfields.text: KNotification Desktop notifications Introduction KNotification is used to notify the user of an event It covers feedback and persistent events
